author: EM
text:
I decided to give an update on my experience. I sell professionally and since the last post things got a bit better.
As a seller I have advice for: 
- direct shipping: photograph, videotape items, attach security tags and ship. you want to avoid the item being worn and returned. (just happened again with a pair of earrings, exactly 14 days of receipt and last day to return-  I am looking to buy hygiene-locks for jewelry)

- they lost a dustbag of a bag and told me i sent without. they compensated with the brands dustbag but not the one that bag came with (different style and color) 

-double check if you get paid or not.
sometimes payments have been missing and i had to chase them. 

- check if earnings are matching with money that is sent- recently sold two items at the same price but got different amounts 

-their photo upload improved, but now its difficult to add photos from weeks ago - have to scroll through everything as can't choose albums

- I feel like they are really trying to fix their issues they are having or had in the past. 

if you are prepared for the jungle then you won't face any issues ;)
title: update on VC

author: Chey
text:
I’ve had the worst experience being a seller with this company. Not luxury at all, if anything you get scammed.
 
My £1200 Burberry coat was kept by them for MONTHS while I was emailing them asking for it back. 2 people told me they’d already sent it back. When I threatened them the third time they FINALLY sent it back and said they would “look into it”, they didn’t. They would’ve kept it had I not kept pursuing.  

I’ve sent a Louis Vuitton bag (paid well over £1000) and it was in PERFECT condition. They sent me an email saying “it has defects” and there was a thread loose and some dirt and marks inside the bag. How it this possible when it’s been kept in the box since purchased and I checked it and photographed it before sending and it’s pristine condition with no damage? I contacted support and they said that was how it was received and “they’ll look into it”. Ridiculous. NOTHING WILL BE DONE. If I receive it back and it’s worse than I sent it (which already seems it is!) I will be making a formal complaint. 

Plenty, plenty more to complain about. Will no longer be selling items on the site, waste of time and definitely not worth the money- they take 12% of what you make. 

Customer service says the same thing over and over to everything “this never happens” “we’re sincerely sorry” “I’ll look into it”. That’s great if it’s true, but these things have been said to me every time- in a dozen of complaints now. Not worth the hassle. 

If you don’t want your EXPENSIVE DESIGNER items to be damaged or stolen, I’d stay away. I’ll be finding a new site to sell on- there are many with none of these issues. What they get away with should be illegal…
title: Avoid if you don’t like getting scammed…
